description: This file contains pure reducer functions for handling LoginState in a Kotlin-based Android project. It manages user intents, validation, and simulates authentication logic, ensuring a predictable and testable state management.

methods.name: reduce
methods.description: Applies user intent to the current login state to produce a new state, handling email change, password change, and submission.

methods.name: reduceSubmitStart
methods.description: Initiates submit process by validating inputs, entering loading state if valid, or returning error state.

methods.name: reduceSubmitResult
methods.description: Processes the result of a simulated authentication attempt, updating the state to success or error accordingly.

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Validates email and password inputs, returning error messages if invalid.

methods.name: isEmailLike
methods.description: Performs a lightweight regex check to determine if an email string resembles a valid email format.

methods.name: simulateAuth
methods.description: Simulates authentication by checking if email ends with '@example.com' and if password length is at least 6.
